The 130 page DM's Workbook, designed to be used with or without the MYPWDF2 Digital Maps Package, contains 52 full color, hand drawn, interconnecting maps plus random tables to help stock them.

Every dungeon map includes a planning page for you to record notes, either before or during play! It serves as a permanent record of your ultimate mega-dungeon, which saves you storing endless loose sheets.

YOU decide what's in your dungeon.

Every page is YOUR adventure.

boardgame.name: Never Meet Again
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

O ye'll tak' the high road and I'll tak' the low road, and I'll be in Scotland afore ye. But me and my true love will never meet again, on the bonnie, bonnie banks o' Loch Lomond.

This Cthulhu Dark Ages scenario is playable in one or two sessions and is suitable for two or more players.

Our Hero Has Died, Why Won't He Stay Buried?

A hero has died and the people he served want to do him honor. Three times that have laid him in state in the church, and three times his body has been discovered the next day lying naked in the churchyard, sprawled among the stones.

The priest offered to spend the night praying for him but was found dead the next day, apparently drowned without so much as a drop of water near him.

Half the town now thinks the dead man is some kind of revenant or ghoul, and the call goes out: who can help bury the Scotsman?

boardgame.name: The Thrice-Cursed Town of Ramen-Llama-Ring-Gone: An Annual Report
boardgame.description:
Guide to the setting-neutral town of Ramen-Llama-Ring-Gone. Information includes:
- History of the town
- The three curses that have befallen the town
- Points of interest and events of the town
- Local scuttlebutt
- Prominent townsfolk
- Birth announcements and obituaries
- Town Map

Created as part of the 2021 24-Hour RPG Geek Supplement Contest.
boardgame.rpghonor: 2021 RPG Geek 24 Hour RPG Supplement Winner

boardgame.name: Wampir
boardgame.description:
It is most probably an unlicensed copy of GW's The Fury of Dracula. Mechanics, components and theme were taken from Dracula. Agnieszka Żak is credited in the rulebook for "Game idea". Neither the original designer of The Fury of Dracula nor Games Workshop are credited.

Theme was adjusted to be more "polish" and completely new artwork was created. The map was also changed — the connections are different and instead of traveling trough XIX century western Europe, we have something similar to Poland territory in years 1918-1945.

boardgame.name: So, You've Been Eaten.: Dyspepto-Beastmol
boardgame.description:
As part of the Beast’s reaction to the Miner’s presence, its bowels secrete a special antacid that exobiologists have termed Dyspepto-Beastmol. Should they come in close contact with it, an
enterprising Miner may use it as a temporary boost to power more actions.
However, if dislodged from its naturally occurring sources, it will disperse and enhance the Beast’s Immune Responses.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: So, You've Been Eaten.: Confused Immune System
So, You've Been Eaten.: Confused Immune System

boardgame.name: Das Spiel der Werbung
boardgame.description:
In the Das Spiel der Werbung ("Game of Advertising"), the players each run an advertising agency with which they have to collect 50 medals as quickly as possible.

The players move their figures across the board with 2 dice and can move onto budget fields or event fields. On "budget" fields they receive a "budget" card and thus medals if they get through the "pitch" (answer a question correctly, solve an advertising task, etc.) and can pay the presentation costs. On event fields, cards are drawn and you can win or lose money and medals.

The questions included in the game require a basic knowledge of the advertising industry.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Aliens: Another Glorious Day in the Corps! – Alien Warriors
boardgame.description:
Extra models to add to the game.
High Quality hard plastic 30mm scale miniatures representing the iconic hostiles from the 1986 film ALIENS
Includes three plastic sprues and instruction sheet to build

12 X Alien Warriors
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Aliens: Another Glorious Day in the Corps

boardgame.name: PatagoMar
boardgame.description:
In PatagoMar, players collect sets of fish in order to advance around a victory point track.
In your turn, you can ask another player for a certain type of fish in their hand (which you must also have at least one card of). If the asked player has this kind of fish, they have to give you all cards of that kind. Keep asking players until they say no; then draw a card from the pile - if it matches your request, you can still continue asking.
At the end of your round, you can decide to discard sets of the same fish to receive the points printed on the respective cards. Move your pawn forward accordingly - the first player to complete a lap, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Distant Stars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Distant Stars is a homebrew of Stars Without Number, and Science Fiction RPG by Sine Nomine Publishing. The homebrew mechanics are designed for a game with higher powered heroes, indented for less simulationist and deadly play, instead creating a more high drama and epic style narrative.

This homebrew includes: alternate rules for creating characters with additional abilities, and greater survivability, 5 new foci, and rules for partial success.

boardgame.name: New Avalon High
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The town of New Avalon has always been a place where bizarre things happen, but most the inhabitants tend to look the other way, it’s not worth getting involved. A small and quiet town, where most people know each other, and rumors spread faster than the speed of light."

New Avalon is a setting and set of Skins to be played using the Monsterhearts TTRPG from Avery Alder, first premiered as part of an actual play on Roll4It. New Avalon High is a set of 7 character skins and the New Avalon Town setting.

New Avalon High is designed for playing a game as modern day high school aged incarnations of well known characters from Arthurian Legends, exploring the complicated relationships and power dynamics present in the original legends, in combination with the difficulties of being a teenager. This game is not intended to be a retelling of the legends. But rather a high school AU. What happens if these people are high schoolers? Who falls in love? Who falls to evil? And who is the hero?

boardgame.name: Steven Universe Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

This game is different from other roleplaying games you may have played before. That’s fitting because it’s based on Steven Universe, a show that’s different from other shows you’ve seen before. You will make a character and roleplay that character, but you will also get to narrate the effects of their actions, taking control of non-player characters (NPCs), your foes, and sometimes even other players’ characters. There is one player responsible for running the game (The Authority), but they, if anything, have less control over the game than the other players. The role of the Authority will be to set scenes and answer questions, occasionally giving voice to NPCs, and sometimes narrating events and actions that challenge or expand upon the Gems’ intentions.

The purpose of this game is to collaboratively create a shared story that simulates an episode of Steven Universe, the series created by Rebecca Sugar for Cartoon Network. Appropriately, the focus of the game is on the characters, their relationships and feelings, their histories, and how their actions affect the world and each other, not on their power (though they are powerful) or ability to solve problems (though they do always save the day). This may be difficult at first for some players, but once you get used to taking control of the story, I hope you will find it is as liberating as it is challenging.

The system is designed to guide players and help them create memorable, surprising, and authentic stories. It requires no preparation on the part of the Authority. Everything is created at the table collaboratively. It also is quick to play (60-90 minutes, plus character generation), so you can play twice in a row in about three hours, creating two short “episodes” of the show in one session.

boardgame.name: Under Construction
boardgame.description:
As the new foreman, you have a specific goal: get those buildings constructed! Only to do that you have to find ways of maximizing your efforts with the Construction Vehicles, which end up all over the yard and depending when you use them, they will provide different bonuses.

Plot out the construction of your Buildings by collecting materials, even off turn. Each Building has a special power and can only be constructed once. Often points are gained at times when Buildings are constructed, which can lead to intriguing timing to maximize the value those buildings will earn.

Take care to use abilities to shift dice, even to rows they wouldn’t normally be in, finding the Bulldozer in the Dump Truck’s row can show of some truly versatile play! Plus dice remain where they are until they are used, only then are they rerolled. Did you set yourself up for a great play later on or will your opponents pounce on it first?

Under Construction is a game of utilizing Construction Vehicles to gain their favor and also resources to erect buildings. Buildings create an engine to further utilize the Construction Vehicles. In the end, the player who did both the best will walk away victorious. Watch for clever combos and Vehicles moving outside of their lanes to create chaos and new opportunities.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Marburg-Spiel
boardgame.description:
The players roll their pieces along a given path through the small town of Marburg and are surprised by events on certain fields along the way. In addition, there is some information about the sights of Marburg. The first player to reach the exact finishing square wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: A cagar a la via
boardgame.description:
A clone of "cards against humanity" adapted to Catalan culture.
—user summary

An insulting game not suitable for children, figs and thin-skinned people.
The mechanics of the game are simple. A player draws a red card and reads the question. The rest of the players have to answer with the funniest yellow card they have.

Un joc d’ofendre no apte per a nens, figaflors i gent de pell fina.
La mecànica del joc és simple. Un jugador tira una carta vermella i en llegeix la pregunta. La resta de jugadors han de respondre amb la carta groga més divertida que tinguin. I així fins al final dels dies.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Patrons of the Old World II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Patrons of the Old World, we met a cunning investigator, and Elf diplomat and a talented actress. Part 2 offers another unique set of NPC’s including a once mighty Wizard and wise woman of the woods to include in your next WFRP adventure!

Steeped in subterfuge, machinations and kingdom building, stepping into the Old World is no task for the fainthearted — even with an esteemed mentor to guide you across the Reikland’s rough terrain — there’s no guarantee that some might lead you down a dark alley. Amidst the daily struggle for survival, some remarkable, resilient, and deeply ambitious individuals rise above quotidian concerns to reach for something great. World-weary wizards, hopeless dreamers, and ruthless prophets — all strive for far more than mere survival. These powerful and charismatic patrons just need a bit of assistance to achieve it. Full of incredible knowledge and useful information, these patrons might prove invaluable to your party, but in a grim and perilous world, just who can you trust?

Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay Patrons of the Old World II details four unique NPCs, each with their own string of plot hooks and an ultimate goal for Characters to aid — or hinder — them in achieving. Though located in the Reikland, each may be dropped into an ongoing campaign anywhere in the Empire. Each NPC makes an excellent patron for a group of adventurers, providing several hooks to inspire GMs in creating a series of linked adventures that conclude in the finale with a lasting impact on the Characters’ lives — if not the Empire at large.

Patrons of the Old World includes:

Wilhelm Von Vaulk: A once mighty Wizard, Wilhelm was struck low in battle with a half dozen Orc Shamans. The spark of magic snuffed from his soul, Wilhelm would do anything to get it back — failing that, he will settle for revenge.
Angela Hedamme: A mysterious wise woman of the woods, Angela once held a position of influence in the Empire as trusted midwife to the great and the good, until a premonition of ruin sent her scrabbling for solutions few would countenance.
Bryannah ‘Der Breikase’ Rosendorn: A fish rots from the head down, and there are few so rotten as the Empire’s Nobility — at least in Rosendorn’s view. She will strike at them, wring a new order from them, even if she must wade through a river of blood to do it.
Diel Ulricsson: The great churches of the Empire are corrupt, and even those who have escaped the taint of Chaos preach heresy. Diel has seen Sigmar’s truth, and it guides him now to strike the wicked from the world. Lift the hammer and follow in the path of Sigmar’s chosen.


The Empire is a nation mired in political connivings, injustice, warfare and want — with layers upon layers of resentment and an in-depth knowledge of the Old World, these powerful patrons will liven up any WFRP adventure. Patrons of the Old World II is an excellent and entertaining addition to your gaming table. Packed with NPCs and exciting adventure hooks, this supplement will kickstart your next adventure in Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay!

boardgame.name: Rules for Roles
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Rules for Roles is a set of rules designed to help you create a fun and rewarding roleplaying game (RPG) experience. These rules were designed to be used in any narrative setting. From pioneers exploring the wild west to superheroes keeping the peace in the distant future, these rules will help bring your imagination to life. The first question you may have is, “Why do I even need rules?” The answer is because rules impose unbiased limitations on the players. This makes the RPG more realistic, more challenging, and more engaging. With rules, the players are not all-powerful; they must use their cunning and imagination to overcome their limitations.

boardgame.name: Um, Actually
boardgame.description:
CollegeHumor is joining forces with Wiggles 3D to bring you the long-awaited home version of their popular game show, Um, Actually!

Um, Actually presents you with statements about the fictional worlds of popular movies, TV shows and books. They all sound right... but listen carefully, because each one has a mistake hidden in it somewhere! It's up to you to figure out what's wrong and announce it before anyone else, starting, of course, with the magic phrase: "Um, actually..."

But even if you know nothing about Sailor Moon or Star Wars, you'll find yourself making wild guesses, stumbling into answers, and having laughs along the way!

Customize your game experience by building your game deck before you play. Select the categories that interest YOU the most: Fantasy, Cartoons, Comics, Sci-Fi, Games, AND MORE! Each game consists of 12 rounds of play: 9 questions, 2 shiny questions, and one real-life skills question.

For the regular questions, feel free to butt in with an "Um, Actually" any time you know the answer. For the shiny and real-life skills questions, players will use the whiteboards and markers provided in the game to answer.

The ultimate party game, Um, Actually's discussion prompts on each card encourage hilarious conversations, witty banter, and nerding-out over your favorite fandoms.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Amazing Spider-Man & Black Cat
boardgame.description:
In the years since being bitten by a radioactive spider, Peter Parker's life has been one constant adventure after another. From battling super-powered foes of every size and description to saving New York City more times than he can count, Peter has seen it all. Still, he continues to put everything on the line using his experience, his long list of friends, and sometimes even his longer list of enemies to protect the innocent. Peter Parker is the Amazing Spider-Man, and he wouldn't have it any other way.

Felicia Hardy is a world-renowned cat burglar with the latent ability to manipulate probability, causing her enemies to suffer unpredictable luck. After a chance encounter with Spider-Man, Felicia gave up a life of lawbreaking (well, mostly) to become a crimefighter. Despite an on- again, off-again romance with Spider-Man, she remains one of his closest allies, occasionally even giving up large scores in order to do the right thing. Felicia Hardy is the Black Cat, and the odds have a way of always landing in her favor.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Amazing Spider-Man & Black Cat consists of 2 miniatures, 2 Bases, 2 Character Stat Cards, 3 Team Tactic Cards, and 11 Tokens.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Lizard & Kraven
boardgame.description:
Doctor Curtis Connors was once a genetic biologist and mentor to Peter Parker. He sought a way to use reptile DNA to regrow lost limbs, like his own missing arm. After testing his experimental serum on himself, Connors transformed into the inhuman reptilian creature, Lizard.

Sergei Kravinoff is Kraven the Hunter, a fanatical big-game hunter who seeks to claim Spider-Man as a prize to demonstrate he is the foremost hunter in the world. From the hidden jungles of the Savage Land to the urban landscape of New York City, Kraven will not relent until he has bagged his trophy.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Lizard & Kraven consists of 2 miniatures, 2 Bases, 2 Character Stat Cards, 4 Team Tactic Cards, and 11 Tokens.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mysterio & Carnage
boardgame.description:
Quentin Beck began a life of crime as a frustrated artist. A successful stunt man and special effects creator in Hollywood, he turned to criminal life after failing to gain the recognition he thought he deserved. Donning the mantle of Mysterio, Beck uses illusions, hypnosis, and trickery to enact his criminal schemes. A longtime rival of Spider-Man, Mysterio's gadgets and intelligence allow him to tangle with his super-powered foe.

The killer Cletus Kasady shared a prison cell on Ryker's Island with Eddie Brock, the human host of Venom. Kasady merged with an insane offspring of the original Venom symbiote, which bonded to his bloodstream, transforming him into the deadly and unpredictable villain Carnage.

Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Mysterio & Carnage consists of 2 miniatures, 2 Bases, 2 Character Stat Cards, 3 Team Tactic Cards, and 11 Tokens.

boardgame.name: DOOM: The Board Game – e-Raptor Insert
boardgame.description:
Make your way through each dark mission with the e-Raptor insert with victory! Doom is here. If you are one of the brave players, get in the game!

e-Raptor Insert compatible with Doom is your must-have accessory designed to organize and improve the experience of the gameplay.

Thanks to our insert you can arrange all game components, miniatures, and sleeved cards to keep them in order – no more mess on the table while playing. No more looking for necessary elements during the game.

Moreover, when the box is closed, the components are still kept in order, ready for setting another game faster than ever!

The insert is durable and made of high-quality HDF. To assemble it, there is no glue required. It allows you to hold all components inside the box.

Fits into the box with dimensions: 29.5 x 29.5 x 10.2 cm

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Undying Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pact with a demon, a love lost and a crypt haunted by an undying knight in this 7th-level adventure for the world's greatest roleplaying game.

Three centuries ago, the realm of Alynthi was being terrorised by a dragon named Mordreth.

Sir Robert, Captain of the Order of Divine Light, made a pact with a demon to gain incredible power. In return, the demon stated that Robert would lose the two things most dear to him within ten years of granting him that power.

Sir Robert was able to use that power, not only to vanquish Mordreth, but to imprison the dragon within human form. The imprisonment of the dragon allowed mages to study this extraordinary being and led to great advancements in magic and artificery.

During the ten years that passed, Sir Robert fell in love with his best friend’s wife, Amelia. On a Saturday night, when Sir Robert and Amelia were spending some private time together, the pact with the demon finally came to an end. The demon took possession of Robert, forcing him to murder Amelia, thereby losing the two things most important to him: Amelia and the friendship of Sir Loras, his best friend. Drowned in sorrow and unable to confess to Sir Loras about what happened, he took his own life.

Because of the power bestowed upon him by the demon, Sir Robert had become undying. He rose again several days later in the crypts near the town of Blackside. Realising he had been fooled and filled with endless hatred, he took the life of every living creature within that crypt, denying the dead the peace they deserve.

Even now, three centuries later, Sir Robert still haunts that crypt.

The Undying Knight contains:

An adventure that takes the player characters to unseen locations within the world of Valleria.
New monsters and magic items.
A beautifully designed map for your encounters.
Two map versions: one for the DM, one for the players.
A map with an alternative artstyle.
6 to 10 hours of gameplay.

boardgame.name: Desert Motel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features a Cyberpunk Desert Motel.

User summary:

This is an electronic battlemap primarily intended for use with Roll20.

boardgame.name: Portal Practice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An incantation misspoken, a portal opened, and an evil awoken, in this 5th-level adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Ravencliff is a small fishing village located on the edge of a cliff overlooking the ocean. It was founded by Galford Ravencrest who settled here on this cliff. He built the town up to what it is now. During an orc raid thirty years ago, Galford was slain. Now he rests on the hill above Ravencliff, his most beloved place.

Northwest of Ravencliff lies a huge forest with a tower sticking out. The tower is called Kirin Zul. The archmage Izax resides here together with his apprentice, Zufaris. Zufaris has been practicing portals in the absence of Izax, who clearly forbade it. For two days now, the villagers have been hearing beastial roars and screams coming from the tower. Fearful of magic, they do not dare to venture closer to the tower.

Portal Practice contains:

An adventure that takes the player characters to unseen locations within the world of Valleria.
A compelling story and interesting new NPC's.
4 Beautifully designed maps for your encounters.
Two map versions: one for the DM, one for the players.
4 to 8 hours of gameplay.

boardgame.name: Cult of Carnage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Break a domination ritual, stop a wicked necromancer and save a little girl in this 10th-level adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game.

Centuries ago, the temple of Cairn Urgol was used as a place of worship. The local townsfolk would come here to pay respect to their gods. The temple was looked after by five temple keepers who were elected by the people.

One day, the keepers of the temple had a visitor, a giant minotaur named Hesra. Hesra was unusually peaceful and intelligent for a minotaur, which made the keepers believe that Hesra was a reincarnation of their god, and so, they started to worship him.

Not soon after, the locals found out about their pagan beliefs. They took matters into their own hands and hanged the heretics, shackled their pagan god and buried it alive along with the temple keepers in a crypt below the temple.

Three weeks ago, a dangerous necromancer called Reks Doghor, and his subordinate cultists moved into these ruins to exercise their foul and dark magic. Reks learned of these ruins and what transpired here through ancient texts left by his forefathers.

Reks Doghor is attempting to create and enslave minotaurs which are notoriously hard to control. Because the domination magic requires a human subject to transform, the cultsist were ordered by Reks to abduct the local townsfolk. Reks believes that when he masters this new form of domination magic, it’ll eventually make him able to dominate Hesra and use him as a weapon of carnage.

Cult of Carnage contains:

An adventure that takes the player characters to unseen locations within the world of Valleria.
New monsters.
Three beautifully designed maps for your encounters.
Two map versions: one for the DM, one for the players.
4 to 8 hours of gameplay.

boardgame.name: Diner & Alleys
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features a Cyberpunk Diner with with also the front neon lit alley and the back alley of the diner.

User summary:

This is an electronic battlemap primarily intended for use with Roll20.

boardgame.name: Kimura Clinic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features the Cyberpunk Clinic known as the `Kimura Clinic´. It includes 9 map sections.

User summary:

This is an electronic battlemap primarily intended for use with Roll20.

boardgame.name: Flesh Market
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features the Red Light District known as `The Flesh Market´. It includes 4 main map sections, a full version of the map and a bonus apartment terrace map.

As light turns to darkness, the neon lit alleys of the `Flesh Market´ burst into life. The garish signs lead the way to the houses that offer sublime pleasures of the flesh. Projected images of sparsely clad men and women are displayed, in a bid to reel in the depraved souls from the street. These sinners of the city will obtain their nightly fix in `The Flesh Market´ that caters to every desire.

User summary:

This is an electronic battlemap primarily intended for use with Roll20.

boardgame.name: Factory
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This bundle features the Cyberpunk Factory: It includes 4 animated map views of the map. They are fully animated with lights, reflections and smoke. Animated version compatible with Astral, FoundryVTT and televisions.

boardgame.name: Gambling Joint
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Cyberpunk Gambling Joint with a commercial alley. It includes 4 sections. The maps have animated rain, lighting and smoke.

boardgame.name: Forged in Hellfire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of level 6–7

The implements of war required for any serious campaign of subjugation and conquest are plentiful indeed, and maintaining a steady supply of weaponry is of tantamount importance. So far, the Dread Tyrant’s armies have excelled in their inexorable march towards total dominance, crushing any resistance with an iron fist.

This is about to change.

The Dread Tyrant’s adversaries have managed to pinpoint to location of one of his most vital garrisons, a forge that provides a significant amount of weapons to his war effort. Going deep undercover behind enemy lines, it is up to the party to disrupt the Dread Tyrant’s supply chain and end the ceaseless production of weapons Forged in Hellfire!

boardgame.name: Mermaid Mayhem
boardgame.description:
Mermaid Mayhem is an exciting card based adventure for ages 8 and up! Take your mermaid battle squad on a danger filled treasure hunt. Grow your party and punish your foes as you race to claim the most treasure.

On their turn they will play cards from their hand to build their team then draw from the deck to find upgrades, treasures, and encounters. Players can also choose to defeat a boss once strong enough. The game ends when no more bosses can be defeated.

The player with the most treasure at the end of the game wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 18: 10 rounds of rock-paper-scissors with 18 fingers
boardgame.description:
This game is a simple two player game where you play rock-paper-scissors 10 times, but only 18 fingers can be used in total across all 10 games. Each player starts with 18 sticks to represent the number of fingers available to play. You lose 5 sticks for paper (paa) and 2 sticks for scissors (choki). Rock (guu) doesn't reduce any sticks.

If you win a round, you will get 1 point, but you get 2 points in the 6th and 10th rounds. Draws (aiko) don't score points either. Try to use up as many of your sticks as possible, because the remaining sticks will be deducted from your score. Calculate your score after 10 rock-paper-scissors games. The one with the most points wins. If the numbers are the same, it is a draw. If you wise, you can play "18" all over again as the tie-breaker.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: KUDARANAIMONO factory (くだらないもの工房)

listing.notes:
Brand new One box corner was wrinkled during transit Happy to send photos if you'd like
Stored in Temperature-controlled game storage room since acquisition Dedicated shelf space -- not stacked No smoking house, etc. and our games are handled and packed carefully
Discount shipping will be calculated based on actual location.

boardgame.name: The Starry Throne
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In The Starry Throne, a group of level-8 adventurers travels to the Red Desert, interested in rumors about an ancient elven temple buried in the sand. Gadino Veren, a researcher and explorer, claims to have a magic key that might be necessary to open a legendary gate in the elven temple. However, the elves shut that gate forever for a reason...

The temple is filled with traps and immortal guardians that have the sole task of impeding anyone from using the throne again. If the heroes wish to learn more about the ancient elven culture and the main purpose of the throne despite the several grim warnings, they must overcome all the challenges and defeat the eternal guardians of the throne.

boardgame.name: Arrethtrae
boardgame.description:
The Kingdom Series Board Game follows the books of The Kingdom Series and The Knights of Arrethtrae very closely. A familiarity with the books will lead to a quick understanding of how the game is played.

The Kingdom of Arrethtrae is divided into thirty territories. At the beginning of the game, each territory is occupied and controlled by the Dark Knight and his Shadow Warriors. The mission is to retake as many of the territories for the Prince as possible before He returns on His ship as He journeys from the Kingdom Across the Sea. It will take Him ten rounds of play to reach the city of Chessington. Once the Prince reaches the docks at Chessington, the game is over. Every knight has the opportunity to retake one territory on each turn by battling against Shadow Warriors and possibly creatures. If a knight is able to retake a territory on his turn, he will acquire a precious resource or weapon to help fight future battles. A knight will usually not know the scope of the battle until he or she enters the territory and draws a battle card. The knight may face a single Shadow Warrior, multiple Shadow Warriors, creatures, and even a Stronghold. Weapons and resources will be necessary to retake a territory with creatures or Strongholds.

One to six players can play the game, but there will always be six knights represented on the board. For example, if there is only one player, he will control all six of the knights. If there are three players, each player will control two knights. For four or five players, one or two of the players must control two knights or those knights can be controlled by all players jointly. All six knights are encouraged to work together and strategize on how to recover as many territories as possible. Only through teamwork and keen strategy is a team of knights successful. Victory occurs in varying degrees, for each territory and its people are precious to the Prince. Ultimate victory occurs when all thirty territories are recovered before the Prince arrives.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SPQR: Revised edition – Warband Skirmishes in the Ancient World
boardgame.description:
Following the initial release of SPQR in 2019, we have been inundated with player feedback concerning the game mechanics. It is always important that we take into account the wisdom of practising wargamers and humbly recognise some of the issues raised by players in the SPQR community. We have this taken some of those suggestions and reworked and streamlined the game system to alleviate these issues, as well as rebalancing and tweaking unit point structures to promote overall balance.

In SPQR, players take command of a warband and lead it to victory, glory, and legend!
With a lightning fast and easy-to-play system, SPQR allows you to build a complete warband capable of scouting out enemy armies, clashing across borders, and conducting raids on farms and villages.

SPQR also includes a complete campaign system, so you can watch as your heroes rise in stature and warband increases in size, while each warband features specialised scenarios to reflect its own tactics and methods of waging war.

Hire mercenaries or lead your fierce troops with Heroes of Legend - let nothing stand in your way as you conquer all for the glory of your nation and the gods themselves!

Complete warband lists are included for:

Caesar's Legions
Gaul
Dacia & Sarmatia
Imperial Rome
Britain
Germania
Macedonia
Athens
Sparta
Thebes
Persia
Iberia


–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: SPQR: Warband Combat in the Ancient World

boardgame.name: Grave Matters
boardgame.description:
Publisher Summary

New uses for dry corpses - a skeletal expansion for Mork Borg.

The prophecy came true, now it's time to run. Grave Matters is a 50 pages digital booklet full of new material for your Mörk Borg games, all with a common skeletal theme. Grave Matters is not a stand-alone game and a copy of Mörk Borg is required to use it.

boardgame.name: Tomadaca
boardgame.description:
Clay poker chips are stacked on a central, circular wooden board in 3 stacks of 16 chips of randomly mixed colors (5 colors, RED, BLUE, GREEN, YELLOW, BLACK). Traditional values are generally assigned to the colors (i.e. RED = $5), but some color values can change for particular players based on various bonuses awarded.

Players take turns with opportunities to TAKE one poker chip for themselves from the top of any one stack or GIVE one to another player from the top of any one stack. The latter action is only constructive for winning because on the GIVER's next turn, it awards him the bonus of taking exactly 2 chips from the top of any combination of stacks (or 2 from the top of the same stack); once per round they may even take 3 chips in the same manner.

Play proceeds until rounds equal to the number of players are played. Each round, values are tallied; the final accumulative highest grand total tally wins.

This is mostly a strategy game with not much luck, except for the initial set-up that offers a bit of luck; this is balanced by letting each player start a round in a game.

TOMA: Take; DACA: Give (in Spanish)

boardgame.name: Cold Case: A Pinch of Murder
boardgame.description: The game includes fictional files and materials related to a decades-old murder. The player or players work cooperatively to study the materials, looking for clues in an attempt to solve the case. When they think they have the correct solution, the players go to the publisher's website, and answer some questions to determine how well they did.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Hades Item-Night God: LARP
boardgame.description:
Goal of the Game:
Players need to work together to get a perfect ENDing. Then convince the City God (Cheng Huang) to agree it.

A player plays as Yuelao (Chinese Cupid) to be the host.

Phase 1: Day Patrol
There are memories in 13 rooms. Players owns limit joss sticks to explore different 13 rooms to get clue. If players explore 8 rooms, they will goes to phase 2.

Phase 2: Night Watch
Players has to discuss with each other to get own clue in 60 minutes.

Phase 3: Trial
There are different characters for each player. Player will provide information from previous phase to get the final ENDing.

boardgame.name: Hades Item: Board game
boardgame.description:
Goal of the game: Players are the guards of City God (Cheng Huang) and try to arrest the phantoms fleeing everywhere.

Shuffle the Phantoms- Fleeing tiles and distribute 3 tokens to every player. Then the game bigins.

Phase 1: Night Watch
There are 9 actions for all players. Different actions costs different arresting tiles. Players owns limit arresting tiles to do actions. If player runs out of arresting tiles or want to stop at time, then it's next player's turn.

Phase 2: Night Patrol
Players has do decide to arrest or not.

Phase 3: Night Trial
If the players arrest the Phantoms- Fleeing successfully, he will get the Phantoms- Fleeing tiles. If not, player will lose arresting tiles

Phase 4: Day Patrol
If player catch correct Phantoms- Fleeing, the player wins.

boardgame.name: Hades Item: Six paths – Puzzle book
boardgame.description:
Goal of the game:
Player has to solve the puzzle to get the final truth!

There are different clue in 10 post cards. Player has to use the cooper coins and compass to get corresponding words or pictures. If you can go through to 10th Puzzle, and figure it out, you win the game

boardgame.name: Shotguns & Zombies: Zero Hour
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Planet Earth, year 20XX. After the great global pandemic, the world slowly began to recover.

User summary:

Characters in the game are enhanced human members of the Zombie Extermination Task Force. New Z.E.T.F. males receive enhancement shots in the stomach; new Z.E.T.F. females receive enhancement shots in the breast. Z.E.T.F. members also are subjected to forced reproduction programs; the most-fecund females are classified as Mother o' Mares and held in "dark chambers not two floors below street level". Z.E.T.F. members not selected for forced reproduction enter a program of training and brainwashing which results in about an 80% morality rate. The lucky (?) few who survive become active agents.

Characters in the game are defined by four Attributes (Focus, Vigor, Dexterity, Agility) and their type of gear (Sneaking, Assault, Armored). Characters also have an assigned primary and secondary weapon.

boardgame.name: RAID Bosses
boardgame.description:
Boot up your computer, you’re a gamer trying to load into your favorite online fantasy game, but to complete the process you will have to defeat 1 of 6 unique RAID Bosses that guard the Server’s files.

A hand building, cool-down management, raid boss battle game. You will be building a hand of Asset files by purchasing them from an always shifting queue of 5 cards, using Code, Sound, Video and Bug symbols you've rolled for the turn.

Pay the cost in Load Pixels to play Asset cards from your hand that trigger various effects, like reducing the RAID Boss's health or armor. Once Asset cards are played, they will return to your hand over time as Load Pixels are removed from them.

Manage your computer's Heat Level carefully, rolling too many Bug symbols or Overheating your computer will trigger harmful effects!

Win the game when the RAID Boss's health value is 0.
Lose the game when your health value is 0.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Agronomy
boardgame.description:
You are a crop farmer in the modern world trying to make a living in an ever-fluctuating market. You’re primarily a Wheat farmer but are now experimenting with other crops as the market has become saturated. You've narrowed your choices between Rice, Oats, Corn, Barley or Quinoa to add to your harvest in hopes of getting ahead of the market and to turn a better profit. However, the competition is experimenting with the same philosophy. Can you outthink your neighbors and develop a strategy that yields a better return? Or will you fall victim to your poor investment decisions?

Supporting up to 9 players, Agronomy is the deck building game that combines the reality of life on the farm with real world economics. Each player begins the game with a deck of 8 wheat and 2 random specialty crops. Every round, players take their turns simultaneously and reveal their hands to determine the market value of each crop. Investing in equipment cards will either increase the quantity of your crops or decrease the cost of purchasing additional crops. Market cards will directly affect the value of your crops and in some cases your opponent's. Research cards will either disrupt your opponent's game play or enhance your own. With 24 different cards to choose from, players will randomly choose 3 cards from each category to create a different and exciting challenge each game. Each player has a common goal of being the first to reach $60, but every dollar spent takes you further away from goal. So invest wisely.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Knockabout / Warp 6
boardgame.description: Includes Knockabout and Warp 6 in one plastic clamshell box.

boardgame.name: Cudgel Duel: Franco's first counterstrikes at the Ebro, Aug-Sep 1938
boardgame.description:
"Cudgel Duel: Franco's First Counterstrikes at the Ebro, Aug-Sep 1938" is a FREE Print and Play wargame; the first one depicting the second phase of the Climatic Battle of the Ebro. The battle composed of a series of vicious counterattacks that ended, after much blood spilling, pushing the Republican army to the left bank of the river it had crossed 4 months before.

The game is a Battalion level simulation of the battle, played on a hexagonal grid with hexides spanning 500 meters and 8 hour turns. The turns consist of successive divisional activations and separate air and administrative phases. The scenarios depict five of the bloody counter-offensives that took place between August and October 1938.

Status markers and air operations are handled in separate charts. Maneuver, morale, intelligence, enemy reaction and divisional assets play a significant part in the battle management. Combat resolution is interactive and fluid, maximizing unpredictability.

The game includes a set of rules, one scenario booklet, one A2 map, three air operations charts, ten corps asset charts, and three, two sided, counter sheets. One six sided die and, optionally, two opaque cups are also required.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Bed, Bath, & Behemoth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An epic Menagerie Press 5e adventure for 17th-20th level characters

The adventurers arrive at the Billowing Steam, only to find that a behemoth has moved into the inn’s famed hot spring and now refuses to leave. Due to the machinations of a young, upstart behemoth named Belmush, what starts as simple pest removal becomes a fight for the future of the world.

boardgame.name: The Sci-Fi Bundle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of the sci-fi from Stephanie McAlea's Cartomancy series in PDF format at 300dpi. Ship details, new and different star maps for sci-fi RPGs, and otherworldly locations all go to giving an enterprising GM or author a background for use at their table.

boardgame.name: Fantasy AGE Trojan War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cross the Wine-Dark Sea and Storm the Walls of Troy Again!

Fantasy AGE Trojan War revives the classic 3rd Era historical fantasy supplement in streamlined form, for the Fantasy AGE RPG. This book explores the Homeric Age: a period that’s half history, half myth, and all about dramatic action, where gods and heroes battle each other…and the inescapable judgment of destiny. Enter the Iliad and other ancient tales in Fantasy AGE, using a host of new options:

Play Achaean Greeks, Trojans, and other ancient peoples, from Amazons to the divine offspring, with new backgrounds appropriate to the era.
New talents and specializations, from the Swift-Footed fighting style to Amazon ferocity and the strange magic of the Pharmakeus.
New magical Arcana, items, and discussions of the role of magic in Homeric mythology.
Weapons, armor, and other gear appropriate to the Homeric Age, including rules for hit locations and partial armor in combat.
Chariots and ships of the Homeric Age, and how to use them.
Rules for divine intervention which let gods and heroes meaningfully interact without compromising divine immortality. Fall under the eye of a deity through a Divine Bond, or feel the wrath of their manifestations.
Advice for Game Mastering the Homeric Age, from changing mythology to suit you to interpreting Fantasy AGE monsters through the lens of Greek Mythology.

boardgame.name: Human Compost
boardgame.description:
A 15mm miniatures game of mutant warfare set in the post apocalyptic future.

One of four players take turns moving through a barren wasteland looking for the remnants of previous humans to feed to the toxic pits. After acquiring the correct combination of human remnants, players spawn one of 4 large mutants that can be used to destroy your opponent.

Solo rules allow a player to fight against one or many opponents depending on the desired difficulty.

Game is played on a hexagonal map and includes 4 main 15mm figures, 4 mutant monsters and 4 auxiliary characters with optional terrain pieces.

boardgame.name: Li.. La.. Löffelspiel
boardgame.description:
The players are supposed to spoon out of the plate as quickly as possible all the vegetable pieces that can be seen on the card that has just been turned over. But it's not as easy as it sounds, because the spoons have joints and bend exactly when you don't need them, making you lose the carrot you just picked up very quickly. For smaller children who want to play along, you can also push the spoon together and thus make the handle immovable.

—user summary;;

boardgame.name: Case Closed: Mystery in the Mansion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pick-your-own-path and puzzle-packed mystery collide in the first book in Lauren Magaziner’s hilarious and high-stakes three-book middle grade series in which the reader must help Carlos and his friends put together the clues to save his mom’s detective agency.

In this wildly entertaining and interactive adventure, YOU pick which suspects to interview, which questions to ask, and which clues to follow. You pick the path—you crack the case!

Carlos Serrano has never solved a mystery in his life. But when Carlos’s mom gets sick with a flu on the morning of an investigation that could save her failing detective agency, Carlos takes on the case.

With the help of his best friend, Eliza, and her wild little brother, Frank, Carlos must uncover a mystery involving an eccentric local millionaire, anonymous death threats, and a buried treasure. But with tricky riddles, cagey suspects, hidden secrets, and dozens of impossible choices, they need your help!

Can you help Carlos and his friends find the culprit and save Las Pistas Detective Agency? Or will it be case closed?

boardgame.name: Case Closed: Stolen from the Studio
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lauren Magaziner’s hilarious and high-stakes middle grade series gets a touch of Hollywood glamor! Pick-your-own-path and puzzle-packed mystery collide in this star-studded sequel in which the reader must help Carlos and his friends solve the disappearance of a famous teen actress.

In this wildly entertaining and interactive adventure, YOU pick which suspects to interview, which questions to ask, and which clues to follow. You pick the path—you crack the case!

Carlos Serrano needs your help—again! His mother has received an urgent assignment to find the missing star of a wildly popular TV show, but she won’t let Carlos investigate!

With his genius friend, Eliza, and her little brother, Frank, along for the case, Carlos is excited to examine the studio for clues and interrogate suspects on the set of Teen Witch, but he has to keep his detective work hidden from his mother's laser-sharp gaze. And just like before, he can’t do it without you!

Can you help Carlos and his friends solve the puzzles and stay out of trouble long enough to save Layla Jay? Or will it be case closed?

boardgame.name: Case Closed: Haunting at the Hotel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pick-your-own-path and puzzle-packed mystery collide in the third book in Lauren Magaziner’s hilarious and interactive middle grade series in which the reader must help Carlos and his friends hunt ghosts at a haunted hotel.

In this wildly entertaining adventure, YOU pick which suspects to interview, which questions to ask, and which clues to follow. You pick the path—you crack the case!

Carlos Serrano is now officially an apprentice detective at Las Pistas Detective Agency. He finally earned his mom’s trust, but his next case will be his most difficult one yet. Guests at a creepy mountain hotel are complaining of weird disturbances, threatening messages, and hair-raising howls!

Carlos, along with his best friend, Eliza, and her wacky little brother, Frank, arrive on the scene to investigate a . . . ghost? What secrets is this haunted hotel hiding? With tricky puzzles, ghoulish secrets, ectoplasmic enemies, and dozens of impossible choices, these junior detectives need your sleuthing skills!

Can you help Carlos and his friends unravel the mystery before it’s too late? Or will it be case closed?

boardgame.name: Karten-Würfeln
boardgame.description: Who manages to get the most cards through lucky dice rolling and clever calculations?

boardgame.name: Doobidoo
boardgame.description:
Doobidoo makes everyday life a party and the party even more festive. There are no occasions that do not get more fun and happier with Doobidoo. Like music is all that is required. But are you also quick-thinking, an undiscovered Monet or do you sing like a god? Then you will love Doobidoo.

Collect letters by scoring points on the different squares on the board. Sing, draw, answer questions,
think fast and guess. Do not hesitate to let go and set the tone - that's the way to success. It made that
first manages to form the word DOOBIDOO with its letter tiles wins!

boardgame.name: Mästarnas mästare
boardgame.description: Fight for the title of Master of Masters! On the playing field, will, speed and concentration are challenged in 6 different competition disciplines. Sometimes you have to choose your opponent. In the next moment, everyone is fighting against everyone. After a round on the playing field, the final duel between the strongest players remains.

boardgame.name: Smimando
boardgame.description:
In turn, each player must mime a subject, trying to make the other players guess it. The youngest player starts by drawing a subject-card and turning the spinner that will determine, according to the color of the card, which subject he has to mime. If, for example, the color pink comes out, he will have to mime the word in the card that corresponds to the color pink. If the emoji comes out, he can freely choose one of the six subject-words. He repeats the process by drawing an action card and turning the spinner again, which determines the action to be mimed (for example: THE LION PAINTS).
At this point he proceeds with the mime (one or two minutes of time can be set, at the competitors' choice).
The game stops either at the end of the time or when a contestant guesses both the subject and the action he is performing. In the latter case, both the mime and the first contestant to guess win a token. If no one guesses, no tokens are awareded. The game then continues in the same way counter-clockwise from the last one who mimed. The winner is whoever earns 5 tokens first.

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Naruto: Ninja Arena
boardgame.description:
The Chûnin exams are in full swing ! This is a great opportunity for Naruto, Sasuke, Sakura, Shikamaru, Rock Lee, Tenten, Hinata, Kiba, Temari and Gaara to spar in frenzied bouts and practice mastery of their techniques and special powers. The young Ninjas will use their skills to the best of their ability and try to bring down their rivals by inflicting damage that will add up to wounds, knock outs, or even worse, final elimination. The last Ninja standing wins!

Naruto: Ninja Arena is the first game using the Roll & Clash system. During the game, you throw your dice as quickly as you can and use the results to activate Techniques without stopping the game. Everyone plays at the same time in a frantic battle to be the last Ninja Standing! The game ends when all players are K.O. or eliminated except one.

Note that the Japanime Games version of Naruto: Ninja Arena contains both the original base game from Don't Panic as well as the Genin Pack Expansion.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Naruto: Ninja Arena – Genin Pack Expansion

boardgame.name: PitchCar: Super Slide Powder
boardgame.description: PitchCar: Super Slide Powder includes 1 flask of special powder to increase the speed of the track.

boardgame.name: Tautotì
boardgame.description: Tautotì is a creative writing game based on tautograms, a puzzle game that consists in forming sentences or compositions whose words start with the same letter. The youngest player draws an inspiration card and, immediately after, a letter card. He places them in the center of the table, clearly visible to all players. Then turn the hourglass: each player has the task, in the time of the hourglass, to write on his blackboard a meaningful sentence containing at least one subject represented in the inspiration card. One point is counted for each word in the sentence that begins with the letter drawn. One point is subtracted from this sum for each word that does not have the required initial. If, while composing a sentence, you come to a net of 5 words with the same initial, the score doubles. The game continues with another round of play (the player to the right of the last one draws the inspiration card and the letter card, and so on...). The winner is the one who reaches, first, the score of 35 points (or more, as chosen by the players before starting the game).

boardgame.name: KO Memo
boardgame.description:
The game is based on the memory palace technique, which consists in remembering elements by associating them with known spaces. In this game there are 40 cards set in 8 different rooms of a house. Each card has an out of context object placed in the given environment. Each room has 5 points of interest.

The aim of the game is to remember in sequence the "out of context" object of each tile. The player is facilitated when associating the objects to be remembered to the various rooms and points of interest in the house.

Challenge mode. Each player takes a coloured scoreboard card. The picture cards are shuffled and equally distributed to each player. The remaining cards are set aside. The players place their cards face down in a horizontal row in front of them. The youngest player starts by turning the cards over in their sequence and carefully observing the "out of context" objects for 30 seconds. Then they turns the cards face down again and begins to remember the sequence out loud, naming the objects from left to right and then turning the corresponding card face up for verification, and so on until the end of the row of cards. Each guessed object is worth one point. At the first mistake the player will have to stop and pass the turn to the next player in clockwise order who will play in the same way. At the end of the round, the game goes on until one of the players reaches 20 points (always waiting for the end of the round, so that all players have completed the same number of turns).

Knockout mode. Arrange the cards in a row in the center of the table in multiples of 8, from one to five rows depending on the desired difficulty. All players observe the series for 30 seconds. At the end the youngest player turns the cards face down and begins to remember the sequence, naming the subject on each card and then turning the card over for verification. At the first mistake, the uncovered tiles are turned face down once again and the second player begins. The first player who remembers all the objects wins.

boardgame.name: The Game Master's Dungeon Journal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This specially designed and tested Dungeon Journal is to be used for campaigns of 10-12 sessions or adventures and has been created for everyday Game Masters, Professional Dungeon Masters, and Therapeutic Game/Dungeon Masters.

You will find grid paper to draw out the map that you will use for your campaign as well as important pages to help build the setting of your campaign.

This can be used for worlds that you develop on your own, use from books, and for worlds that use a collaborative approach and those who do not.

boardgame.name: The Sundered World
boardgame.description:
The New World of Darkness, circa. 5500 - 5000 BCE

From the introduction:

Seven thousand years before the modern era, we lived in a true age of darkness. Beyond the tilled fields and muddy cattle pastures, endless glades and ominous forests gird the meagre campfires that pass for civilisation. The changing seasons and the weather or disease they bring are almost as deadly as the malign spirits stalking he wilds. The Great Wolf is the ruler of Pangaea, a primeval merger of the spiritual and physical planes in which his half-wolf children keep what peace they see fit between mankind and the mighty mergers of spirit and flesh that dwell just beyond the mortal world. For the people later generations may come to know as the Vinca, life is as short and desperate as it is brutal. Superstition reigns high and mighty over reason, often considered a better guide to the many supernatural forces of this realm than what man is capable of comprehending.

boardgame.name: Assault on the Colossus
boardgame.description:
“The Colossus is fast approaching to the Village! Someone must do something or there will be nothing left behind."

In the role of the Hero you must knock down the Colossus. To perform this feat you must climb through the levels of his body until you reach the sensitive point, his head, and deliver the coup de grace. To achieve this you must wisely manage your stamina, fatigue and vitality. Hurry! The Colossus is moving and the fate of everyone who loves you rests in your hands.

Overview
The Hero starts at ground level (level 0). Each turn you either attempt to climb to the next body spot or hold on to rest and recover. Then the Colossus will act, either attempting to shake off the Hero or advance towards the Village.

—description from the designer

The game continues until the Hero’s vitality reaches zero, the Colossus is killed, or the Colossus reaches the Village.

—user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Cossum's Universal Constructs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cossum is a small but fast growing village on the northern shore of Maer Dualdon. The village is lucky to have a contingent of constructs built by a talented local inventor, Carol Borgwiggle. The constructs work as servants and laborers. Recently strange tracks from an unknown creature were discovered in the village coming from an area of the woods that is said to be haunted. Can the party uncover the truth before it is too late?

A 4-Hour Dungeoncraft (AL) Adventure for Characters of Level 5-10, Part of the Dungeoncraft Plague of Ancients campaign for Adventures League Season 10.

Based on the “My, What Big Feet You Have” Adventure Seed. Optimized for a group of 5 players with an APL8.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: Nesciamus Core Rules
boardgame.description:
Nesciamus is a role-playing game about the Reformation, which can be played without a game master.

In the fantastic world of Nesciamus, demons are a real threat and only with the help of the Guardians of Truth is it possible for people to live a normal life. But outside the protective spell circles life is dangerous, and even inside you are not always safe. The Laws of Truth, enacted by the Circle of Twelve, help people avoid demon-promoting behavior. But how do the wanderers, outlaws who must live outside the protection of the guardians, cope? And why is the demon infestation getting steadily worse, despite ever new laws of truth? Perhaps it is time for a change.

boardgame.name: PitchCar: Foam Rail
boardgame.description:
The Foam Rail features an adhesive that allows for it to be re-positioned and reused several times.

Need more rail to unleash your imagination? Create a Bridge, Tunnel, or Gap!

Includes: 1 meter length foam rail.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: BladeShift Worldsiege
boardgame.description:
Dynamic with plenty of depth for experienced re-players, BladeShift is a game in which players take on the guise of a skilled Fighter on a quest to collect 3 remaining elemental affinity seals from the realm of The Shift.
These Seals brought together would allow one to save their realm from the abominations waiting to invade, should they fail their quest, or to mark The Shift realm as a first conquest...

As players progress and level up through the dungeon, so too do the challenging monsters they'll have to face in efforts to return the seal to their gateway.

boardgame.name: Somewhere Under The Rainbow
boardgame.description:
In Somewhere Under The Rainbow, you take on the role of one of the tiny winged critters of Glistening Grove. As a loyal resident of this land, it is your sworn duty to partake in the mysterious process of creating colorful rainbows, using a rare and secret ingredient: the crystalline poop of a Unicorn!

Armed with an enchanted plunger, you will fly your way through piles of multicolored Unicorn Poop and gather precious pieces of feces to build stunning rainbows. At the same time, you’ll need to prepare as many delicious dishes for the Unicorn as possible, to make sure the supply doesn’t run out.

Gameplay: On your turn, you can decide to either "Gather Unicorn Poop" or "Visit the Village". When you Visit the Village, you must perform at least one of the following three actions in whatever order you like:


Rainbow Maker: Trade Poop Tokens for Glitter Cubes by depositing at least 2 tokens of the same color into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The more tokens you deposit at once, the more Glitter Cubes you receive in return.
Market: Use the Glitter Cubes to buy Ingredients at the Market.
Food: Earn Tasty Points by combining any two Ingredients to create a Food of a specific color to feed the Unicorn.


A rainbow is created once all six different colors of Poop Tokens have been deposited into the tube of the Rainbow Maker. The game ends when four rainbows have been created.

Poop Tokens used to make rainbows throughout the game can score you valuable bonus Tasty Points at the end. The more tokens of one color that were used, the more bonus Tasty Points go to the player who has earned the highest number of Tasty Points from Food of that color during the course of the game.

Goal: The player with the highest total number of Tasty Points wins the game, and is officially named the best Rainbow Maker in Glistening Grove!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Scarlet Envelope: Screaming Venice – Art Heist
boardgame.description:
This tabletop escape-room-style mystery takes place in Venice, 2000. THE SCREAM, Edvard Munch’s famous painting & the art's most haunting face, disappears right before the opening of a posh Art Biennale. Art lovers are confused: anyone knows that such a well-known painting is impossible to resell! Was it stolen for ransom? Or to cover up a larger mystery?

Delve into the world of art crime, recover the precious artifact, identify the art thief, and get all the answers about this art heist of the century!

GAME CONTENTS:

Tri-fold brochure featuring real art of Edvard Munch & other famous artists
Cryptic bookmark, a souvenir from the gift shop
Maps of the gallery's first & second floor
Photo from the crime scene with notes
Letter from the President of the Art Biennale
Art Galery Website
Video Security Footage
Audio guided tour of the gallery
Music Soundtrack


Lots of multi-layered puzzles to solve, from visual enigmas to logic and folding puzzles. You will interpret colors, investigate famous paintings (and educate yourself on the way), as well as search the gallery, and learn about Edvard Munch's haunting legacy. Expect all things ART, spiced up with the charming vibe of Venice!

boardgame.name: Direhold Sewers, Flooded Tunnel Network
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Direhold Sewers: Flooded Tunnel Network - 22 Modular Dungeon Tiles for your Adventures.

Direhold Sewers: Flooded Tunnel Network is a printable tile set compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

User summary:

The tiles are distributed in multiple file formats.

boardgame.name: Empyreal: Far Corners
boardgame.description: This mini expansion adds new 4 metro boards, 3 new specialists, and 4 postcards (featuring new metro destinations).

boardgame.name: Direhold Sewers, Flooded Tunnel Network: The Corpse Grinder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

22 Modular Dungeon Tiles for your Adventures.

Direhold Sewers: [The Corpse Grinder] is a printable tile set compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

User summary:

The tiles are distributed in multiple file formats.

boardgame.name: Olympus Races: The racing game of the Gods
boardgame.description:
You are a God. You have been challenged by Zeus and Hera, rulers of Olympus, to take part in a race of epic proportions. With help from fabulous mythological creatures and all the quirky Gods and Goddeses in the Greek Pantheon, be the first to reach the highest peak of Mount Olympus, where eternal glory awaits!

Play as one of eight powerful Gods and Goddesses, each with their own Territory, special powers and gameplay style. Race across the gameboard, using a variety of card effects and advantages on your own Territory to turn the odds in your favour. Be the first player to reach Mount Olympus to win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Direhold Dungeon Corridors and Chambers: The Mortuary
boardgame.description:

The Mortuary from Direhold Dungeon: Corridors and Chambers

Direhold Dungeon: Corridors and Chambers is a printable tile set compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

boardgame.name: Direhold City: The Complete Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Direhold City: The Complete Set - 26 Building and Street Maps for your Adventures.

User summary:

The tiles are distributed in multiple file formats.

boardgame.name: Dupli
boardgame.description:
In the card game Dupli, each player starts with the nine cards in hand. On a turn, you each choose and reveal two cards, then carry out the effects of those cards, which have a rock/paper/scissors style of ranking, along with potential reversals of powers. More than one person can win a round, and the winners split the cards played, with the remainder carrying over to the next round.

After four rounds, whoever has won the most cards wins.

You can play Dupli with fixed hands of nine cards so that everyone has the same options available or by adjusting the card count in the deck based on the number of players, then shuffling and dealing nine cards to each player.

boardgame.name: Victim: Asylum
boardgame.description:
Victim: Asylum is an expansion and serves as a continuation for Victim: The Cursed Forest. Victim: Asylum, similar to its predecessor, revolves around the cooperation of "Victims" trying to escape from an entity called "the Evil". With a brand-new setting and Victims, Victim: Asylum aims to offer a diversity in gameplay. This expansion can be played by 2-6 players. Each game takes about 40-90 minutes to play. Some situations may require components, such as cards or dice, from the main game. Victims and Evils from the main game can also be used in this expansion. The main objective for Victim: Asylum is to find the key, go to the basement, gain access to the Professor's secret tunnel and escape the Asylum before Evil consumes you. Just like the main game, one of the players will become possessed by Evil after the 3rd round, changing their objective to eliminate the other players or sabotaging their attempt to escape.

—description from the publisher

Kickstarter Version

boardgame.name: HYKE
boardgame.description:
HYKE is a poetic communication game in which you create senryū — poems with a 5-7-5 syllable structure, typically about human foibles — in which someone at the table can identify the theme of your creation, but ideally not too easily.

To set up, players submit themes to a central pool, then you draw one of those themes at random, create a senryū based on that theme, and invite others to identify the theme of your creation. Your score is the number of people who guess incorrectly before someone guesses correctly, so you want your poem to be both not too easy to understand and not too difficult to understand.

[The Gallows] - Maps for your Adventures.
